alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 14 at 11:15AM PDT until March 16 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following river in California... Pit River near Canby affecting Modoc County. For the Pit River...including Canby...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Pit River near Canby. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect flooding in Canby and Lookout in Modoc County and Bieber and Nubieber in Lassen County 4300 cfs * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...Minor flood stage of 8.7 feet with 3700 cfs may be reached early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 715 PM PDT.
